attributes.action: Pressure Japan To Stop The Slaughter Of Dolphins
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Shocking dolphin hunt images released by ITV 6.15, Tue Feb 27 2007

Shocking images have emerged of a brutal yet legal dolphin drive hunt in Japan.

Despite being considered one of the most gentle and intelligent creatures on the planet, thousands of dolphins are still captured or killed every year.

The drive hunts see hundreds of the mammals chased, rounded up and slaughtered over a period of hours or even days, while others are dragged away to be sold for up to $100,000 each to marine parks around the world.

Thousands of the creatures are killed this way each year and suffer extensive pain and distress in the process.

The hunts have been widely criticised by organisations, such as the International Whaling Commission, which fear that local dolphin populations could disappear completely if the hunts continue.

It is hoped that by applying international pressure the Japanese Government will cease such brutality.
